body.p: We the Undersigned citizens, of Boone and Kenton Counties, recommend to his Excellency Beriah Magoffin, a remission of the judgment obtained by the Commonwealth of Kentucky against Wickliff Grubbs, (at the September term for 1859 of the Boone Circuit Court,) as security on a recognizance to appear at the court aforesaid, of one James H Landrum, in amount $300.00 The affidavits to be enclosed to Your Excellency will, we think, develop the cause why said Landrum failed to appear and stand. his trial; and without desiring to prejudge the case in question, we can freely say that it, in our view, presents a marked instance wherein Executive clemency would not only be desirable, but, in every respect just and proper. Mr. Landrum, the principal in the recognizance bond aforesaid, we are informed departed this life some time since --

R. Richardson

To His Excellency B Magoffin Govenor of the Comwlth of Ky!

Some two years since I called to see you with reference to a forfeited recognizance of Wickliff Grubb of this county at which time the judgment on the forfeiture was respited & you then directed Grubb should procure the affidavits then spoken of He desires me to say that he has them now & presents them accompanying this memorandum & the petiton on this sheet
y obtly
J W Calvet
